ai-iti38:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti38:2.1_0: “Two thoughts, mendicants, often occur to the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha:
ai-iti38:2.3_0: The Realized One loves kindness and delights in it,
ai-iti38:2.4_0: Then this thought often occurs to him:
ai-iti38:2.5_0: ‘Through this behavior, I shall not hurt any creature firm or frail.’
ai-iti38:3.1_0: Because the Realized One loves seclusion,
ai-iti38:3.2_0: so this thought often occurs to him:
ai-iti38:3.3_0: ‘What is unskillful has been given up.’
ai-iti38:4.1_0: So, mendicants, you too should love kindness and delight in it,
ai-iti38:4.2_0: then this thought will often occur to you:
ai-iti38:4.3_0: ‘Through this behavior, I shall not hurt any creature firm or frail.’
ai-iti38:5.1_0: You too should love seclusion and delight in it,
ai-iti38:5.2_0: then this thought will often occur to you:
ai-iti38:5.3_0: ‘What is unskillful? What is not given up? What should I give up?’”
ai-iti38:5.4_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti38:6.2_0: the Realized One, the bearer of the unbearable:
ai-iti38:6.3_0: first mentioned was thought of sanctuary,
ai-iti38:6.4_0: then the second made clear was seclusion.
ai-iti38:7.1_0: Dispeller of darkness, the great hermit has crossed over:
ai-iti38:7.2_0: the attained, the master, the undefiled.
ai-iti38:7.3_0: In the midst of it all, he is freed in the ending of craving;
ai-iti38:7.4_0: that sage bears their final body;
ai-iti38:7.5_0: they have disposed of Māra, I declare, and gone beyond old age.
ai-iti38:8.1_0: Standing high on a rocky mountain,
ai-iti38:8.2_0: you can see the people all around.
ai-iti38:8.3_0: In just the same way, the all-seer, wise one,
ai-iti38:8.4_0: the Palace made from Dhamma, Visionary One,
ai-iti38:8.5_0: Being rid of sorrow, look upon the people,
ai-iti38:8.6_0: swamped with sorrow, oppressed by rebirth and old age.”
ai-iti38:9.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
